oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Hādhā Rūznāmah-ʼī maʻahu mīqāt layl wa-nahār wa-sāʼir al-awqāt al-maʻlūmah / naqalahu Shaykh Wafā : manuscript, undated
Rūznāmah-ʼī maʻahu mīqāt layl wa-nahār wa-sāʼir al-awqāt al-maʻlūmah
Ruzname-yi maahu mikat-i leyl ve nehar ve sair-i evkat-i malume
Ruznâme-yi Şeyh Vefa
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Vefa , -1490
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Widener Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Calendar with times for the five daily prayers of Islam for each month of the year.

The work is chiefly tables outlined in red ink and filled in small naskh in red and black. The writings around the tables, also outlined, in larger naskh in black ink with use of red for rubrication. ff. 1v and 2r are illuminated with use of blue, orange and crimson.
Probably dates from the late 17th or early 18th century.
The ms. has no colophon but years 1115 AH [1703 or 4 AD], 1124 AH [1712 or 3 AD] and 1140 AH [1727 or 8 AD] written on f. 8v.
MS Arab 397. Houghton Library, Harvard University.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Islamic calendar
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: روزنامۀ شيخ وفاء
